page.title: 04SHOPPING IN OKEHAMPTON
page.content: The town has two pedestrian precincts Red Lion Yard (built on the site of a public house which was knocked down, hence the name). Red Lion Yard is shown in the pictures. The other pedestrian precinct is the Arcade, built 80 years previously. The Arcade has a Victorian domed roof covering such shops as Field and Stream selling guns and fishing tackle, two shoe shops, a tobacconists, camera shop and newsagents. Red Lion Yard is open to the weather, being built in a modern style. A narrow alley from Fore Street opens out into a large court yard. The shops around include a sports shop, a record shop, a bakers, a video shop and the only wine bar in the Okehampton area. Mike Ward
